image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Newspaper Moscow Times declared 'undesirable' by Russian govt amid escalating crackdown on independent media
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 66 Chinese aircraft surround Taiwan in biggest sortie of year
item.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said Thursday it had detected 66 Chinese military aircraft around the island in a 24-hour window, a record-high this year, a day after it said Beijing was conducting exercises in nearby waters. Thursday's record comes a day after Taipei spotted Chinese aircraft around the island that it said were headed to the western Pacific for exercises with the PLA aircraft carrier Shandong.

item.title: Watch: Saudi Airlines catches fire while landing in Pakistan
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: PM Modi lauds India-Austria friendship, shares video showcasing his recent Vienna visit
item.description: During PM Modi's Vienna visit, he received a guard of honour, attended community events, met leaders including Chancellor Nehammer and President Van der Bellen, and took a selfie with Nehammer. The visit marked 75 years of India-Austria relations, filled a 41-year gap, and followed a Moscow trip to meet President Putin.

item.title: Flyer suffers severe burns due to 'scalding hot' tea served amid turbulence, sues JetBlue
item.description: Tahjana Lewis is suing JetBlue for $1.5 million after suffering severe burns from a "scalding hot" tea served during turbulence on a May 15 flight. The complaint highlights gross negligence, citing the tea's dangerous temperature and inadequate assistance from the crew. Lewis experienced severe burns and emotional distress, affecting her ability to work and her daughter's well-being.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: NATO accuses China of 'enabling' Ukraine war; 'antiterrorist' military drills near Poland heighten concerns
item.description: At a Nato summit in Washington, allies pledged F-16 jets to Ukraine and potential future membership for Kyiv. China was criticized for aiding Russia, with concerns about its nuclear and space capabilities. Allies urged China to stop supporting Russia. Meanwhile, China held drills with Belarus near the Polish border, intensifying tensions.

item.title: Biden says pressure on him is driven by elites. Voters paint a more complicated picture
Four killed as heavy rains pound South Korea
item.description: Heavy rains in South Korea result in four fatalities and extensive damage to infrastructure and roads. Landslide warnings issued for 50 regions with 3,500 people stranded. Interior minister notes severity as rare occurrence. Tragic deaths include individuals trapped in flooded areas and swept away by overflowing streams. Total of 44 fatalities reported from recent floods in the country.

item.title: Myanmar junta 'trying to destroy country': UN special rapporteur
item.description: Myanmar's junta appears to be "trying to destroy a country it cannot control", the UN special rapporteur to the country warned on Thursday. "It almost appears as if the Junta is trying to destroy a country that it cannot control."

item.title: 'We are in a fire year': Heat wave sparks alarming wildfire surge in western states of US
item.description: Western states are facing escalating wildfire dangers due to a prolonged heat wave, with temperatures soaring and humidity plummeting. California has already dealt with over 3,500 wildfires this year, burning nearly 325 square miles. Oregon also faces significant fires, while the heat wave affects over 142 million people across the US, breaking numerous heat records and causing several fatalities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New York auction to sell 150-year-old Stegosaurus skeleton: How much will it cost?
item.description: The largest stegosaurus skeleton, Apex, is set to be auctioned in New York, raising concerns among paleontologists about selling rare finds to private collectors. Valued at $4-6 million, it is considered highly significant but controversial in the scientific community.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'The money has absolutely shut off': Joe Biden campaign faces fundraising crisis
item.description: The Biden campaign is struggling with fundraising following a poor debate performance against Trump. Donations have significantly declined, with large contributions potentially dropping by over half. A post-debate fundraising surge quickly dissipated, and donors were left unimpressed. Additionally, there's uncertainty about Biden's commitment to the race amid calls for his withdrawal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Political power couple: Clinton aide Huma Abedin gets engaged to George Soros' son Alex
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump to address Bitcoin 2024 conference on July 27
Project 2025: Inside Trump's plan to reshape America if he wins the presidency
item.description: Project 2025 focuses on a wide range of conservative priorities, including restricting abortion access, rolling back LGBTQ+ rights, abandoning efforts to address climate change and income inequality, and implementing sweeping changes to the federal government workforce. ​​The project calls for the dismissal of thousands of civil servants, expanding presidential power, dismantling the department of education, implementing of tax cuts, banning pornography, and halting sales of the abortion pill, among others. However, the document has faced criticism for its potential to undermine democracy and lead to political violence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I'm not sitting back anymore': Trump's ex-wife Marla Maples is 'open' to serve him as his vice president
item.description: Marla Maples, Donald Trump's ex-wife, expressed her support for his 2024 presidential campaign and openness to being his running mate. In an interview, she emphasized her readiness to be more vocal and support Trump despite his legal issues. Maples downplayed Trump's legal troubles, maintaining her belief in his innocence, and expressed a willingness to serve in any capacity to aid his campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: South Korea to deploy 'StarWars' laser weapons to counter North Korean drones
item.description: South Korea is set to make history by deploying laser weapons to counter North Korean drones, becoming the first nation to do so. The 'StarWars project' will feature cost-efficient and silent weapons capable of taking down drones with precision. Tensions are high as both Koreas continue to violate the armistice, sparking concerns over future conflicts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Terror must fail': Nato sends F-16 jets to bolster Ukraine in new support effort
item.description: Nato allies transfer F-16 jets to Ukraine, fulfilling promises of military aid. Summit pledges 40 billion euros to support Ukraine. Concerns raised about potential conflict with Russia. Allies emphasize unity in defending Nato territory. US Secretary of State highlights importance of deterring Russian aggression.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It's only going to get better': Musk moving on to second person to test brain tech
item.description: Neuralink, led by Elon Musk, is advancing brain-computer interface technology and has moved to its second patient. The first patient, Noland Arbaugh, paralyzed from the shoulders down, successfully controlled a computer cursor with his brain. Neuralink resolved initial issues and aims to implant deeper threads for better signal detection. Musk envisions future enhancements providing superhuman abilities.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: US eyes new defensive strategies to tackle China's industrial policies
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
